page.title: 20ENTERTAINMENT ARTS
page.content: Although there is no major cultural centre within the area surveyed,the inhabitants are within easy travelling distance of several theatre and cinema complexes.People interviewed did not show a preference between the centres at Mold and Chester but based their choice on the actual production or film being shown.At the time of writing this account the following films are being shown:-Watership Down at Mold's Theatre Clwyd and A Passage to India at Chester's ABC.For theatre-goers the choice is between Ballet Rambert and Hair at Mold or The Importance of Being Ernest at Chester's Gateway Theatre. Although both of these are well patronised by the public,they are under constant financial pressure to maintain high standards of production.
